definition: victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
to prevail/to achieve victory/to be victorious

sentences.english: By a titanic effort out footbisexualngl teare won the victory.
sentences.chinese: 我們的球隊付出很大的勤奮，取得了勝利。

sentences.english: Success will not turn my head.
sentences.chinese: 勝利不會讓我頭腦發昏。

sentences.english: The young boxer has copped the prize of the first round.
sentences.chinese: 這位年輕的拳擊手已獲得了第一回合的勝利。

sentences.english: Had Jesus not died on the cross, Christianity would not have triumphed.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌要是不死在十字架上，基督教就無法取得勝利。

sentences.english: Color symbol, the blue symbolizes joy and win loyal to our motherland.
sentences.chinese: 色象徵歡樂和勝利，藍色象徵忠於祖國。

sentences.english: A magnificent gleam of triumph sprang into Cowper-wood's eye.
sentences.chinese: 柯帕伍德的眼睛裏突然透露出勝利的莊嚴的光芒來。

sentences.english: Yuan Shikai quickly seized the fruits of the victory of the 1911 Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 袁世凱迅速篡奪了辛亥革命的勝利果實。

sentences.english: The institute called the policy “a resounding success.
sentences.chinese: 卡託研究所稱這個政策是“一場徹底的勝利。”

sentences.english: The Western victors, however, have secured no such advantages.
sentences.chinese: 然而西方的勝利者卻無此優勢可佔。

sentences.english: Rule No.8: Your school may have done away with winners and losers.
sentences.chinese: 在你的學校也許不存在勝利與失敗，但生活中存在。

sentences.english: De Roquefort allowed the fool a victory.
sentences.chinese: 雷孟達允許這個白癡一點小小的勝利。

sentences.english: Tashi one-upmanship, eventually obtaining victory like riding.
sentences.chinese: 扎西騎術更勝一籌，最終獲得勝利。

sentences.english: After the War of Resistance Against Japan, Tsinghua University was removed from Kunming to Beiping in 1946.
sentences.chinese: 清華大學在抗戰勝利後的1946年由昆明遷回北平。

sentences.english: He was in a new team winning six out of the first seven races.
sentences.chinese: 他在一個在七站比賽中取得了六站勝利的新團隊裏。

sentences.english: Successis often just the right idea away.
sentences.chinese: 勝利與否通常只是一念之差。

sentences.english: We see this platform as winning.
sentences.chinese: 我們把這個平臺視作一種勝利。

definition: to go forward/to forge ahead/to advance/onward
to be defeated/to lose/to fail (e.g. experiments)/failure/defeat/CL:次[ci4]
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
outcome/result/conclusion/in the end/as a result/to kill/to dispatch
huge/great/grand/worthy of the greatest admiration/important (contribution etc)
to fight for/to strive for/to win over
